title: Slash Commands
description: Slash commands available in Claude Code

commands.name: /bug
commands.description: Initiates a bug report workflow, helping you to capture and submit issues you encounter.

commands.name: /clear
commands.description: Clears the current conversation history from the REPL, providing a fresh start.

commands.name: /compact
commands.description: Compacts the conversation history, summarizing previous turns to save tokens and refocus the context.

commands.name: /config
commands.description: Opens an interactive session to show and modify your local and global configuration settings.

commands.name: /cost
commands.description: Displays token usage statistics for the current session, helping you track API costs.

commands.name: /help
commands.description: Shows a help message with a list of available slash commands and their functions.

commands.name: /init
commands.description: Initializes a new `CLAUDE.md` file in your project, documenting the codebase to provide better context to Claude.

commands.name: /login
commands.description: Starts the authentication process to sign you in with your Anthropic account.

commands.name: /logout
commands.description: Signs you out from your current Anthropic account in the CLI.

commands.name: /memory
commands.description: Opens the `CLAUDE.md` file in your editor, allowing you to view or modify Claude's contextual memory for your project.

commands.name: /pr_comments
commands.description: Fetches and displays comments from a specified GitHub pull request, bringing review feedback into your terminal.

commands.name: /review
commands.description: Requests a code review from Claude for the files you've specified or staged in git.

commands.name: /terminal-setup
commands.description: Installs terminal enhancements, such as enabling Shift+Enter for multi-line input without sending.

commands.name: /vim
commands.description: Enables or disables Vim keybindings within the interactive REPL for modal editing.

commands.name: /model
commands.description: Allows you to view or change the AI model being used for the current session.

commands.name: /exit
commands.description: Exits the Claude Code REPL session and returns you to your regular shell prompt.

commands.name: /status
commands.description: Shows a comprehensive status of the Claude Code CLI, including version, model, account info, and API connectivity.
